title: `bazel mod show_extension` output is confusing for fake extensions created by use_repo_rule

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

labels.name: team-Starlark-Interpreter
labels.description: Issues involving the Starlark interpreter used by Bazel

body:
### Description of the bug:


`bazel mod show_extension` output is not valid Starlark

### Which category does this issue belong to?

_No response_

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


In the Bazel repo:

```
‚ùØ bazel mod show_extension '@@//:MODULE.bazel%@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file'
## @@//:MODULE.bazel%@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file:

Fetched repositories:
  - jq_linux_amd64 (imported by <root>)
  - jq_linux_arm64 (imported by <root>)
  - jq_linux_s390x (imported by <root>)
  - jq_macos_amd64 (imported by <root>)
  - jq_macos_arm64 (imported by <root>)
  - jq_windows_amd64 (imported by <root>)

## Usage in <root> from bazel/MODULE.bazel:382
@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file.repo(executable=True, integrity="sha256-xrOn19PntwxvUbcGo7kL0BgzhGxU0yyjLwAn8AIm/20=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.5/jq-linux64"], name="jq_linux_amd64")
@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file.repo(executable=True, integrity="sha256-TdLYoGYd8LIvG7mh+YMPBrbzuPfZEhGh7118TwaotKU=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.7.1/jq-linux-arm64"], name="jq_linux_arm64")
@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file.repo(executable=True, integrity="sha256-hot8PKdCJKAt22EyYd38LkOxLart1etYNz29x/LF+SQ=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.7.1/jq-linux-s390x"], name="jq_linux_s390x")
@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file.repo(executable=True, integrity="sha256-OG6SyYKlb+SFFGjXqTHfyilWDO4wag5mxqG9QGXT2sU=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.5/jq-osx-amd64"], name="jq_macos_amd64")
@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file.repo(executable=True, integrity="sha256-C75hnmY+DeLFUL4v4NJA0HZ5nW+KZStw+gSuqKg2Loo=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.7.1/jq-macos-arm64"], name="jq_macos_arm64")
@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file.repo(executable=True, integrity="sha256-6+zYQLpH779mgihoF4zHIaFRBgk396xAbj0xvQFb3pQ=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.5/jq-win64.exe"], name="jq_windows_amd64")
use_repo(
  @bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl http_file,
  "jq_linux_amd64",
  "jq_linux_arm64",
  "jq_linux_s390x",
  "jq_macos_amd64",
  "jq_macos_arm64",
  "jq_windows_amd64",
)
```

It should probably look like
```starlark
## Usage in <root> from bazel/MODULE.bazel:382
http_file = use_repo_rule("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_file")
http_file(executable=True, integrity="sha256-xrOn19PntwxvUbcGo7kL0BgzhGxU0yyjLwAn8AIm/20=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.5/jq-linux64"], name="jq_linux_amd64")
http_file(executable=True, integrity="sha256-TdLYoGYd8LIvG7mh+YMPBrbzuPfZEhGh7118TwaotKU=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.7.1/jq-linux-arm64"], name="jq_linux_arm64")
http_file(executable=True, integrity="sha256-hot8PKdCJKAt22EyYd38LkOxLart1etYNz29x/LF+SQ=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.7.1/jq-linux-s390x"], name="jq_linux_s390x")
http_file(executable=True, integrity="sha256-OG6SyYKlb+SFFGjXqTHfyilWDO4wag5mxqG9QGXT2sU=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.5/jq-osx-amd64"], name="jq_macos_amd64")
http_file(executable=True, integrity="sha256-C75hnmY+DeLFUL4v4NJA0HZ5nW+KZStw+gSuqKg2Loo=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.7.1/jq-macos-arm64"], name="jq_macos_arm64")
http_file(executable=True, integrity="sha256-6+zYQLpH779mgihoF4zHIaFRBgk396xAbj0xvQFb3pQ=", urls=["https://github.com/jqlang/jq/releases/download/jq-1.5/jq-win64.exe"], name="jq_windows_amd64")
```

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


_No response_

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


development version

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


`bazelisk build src:bazel_nojdk`

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text
git@github.com:bazelbuild/bazel.git
0972528f8d6b236afffa960da6b7c92d023b35df
```

### If this is a regression, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced with bazelisk --bisect.


Not a regression

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

_No response_

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

_No response_
